primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of the nations and the Magi (representing the pagan/secular world) toward the light of Christ to offer their glory and recognize His Lordship.

subject.identificatie: God/The Lamb (as the Light/Source) and the Magi (as the seekers)
tekstueel_bewijs: the glory of God is its light, and its lamp is the Lamb
The God who created the stars... has not set up a separate system... apart from Christ

object.identificatie: The recognition of Christ's Lordship and the consecration of all human glory to Him.
tekstueel_bewijs: everything that is honorable... will be taken up into the kingdom of Christ
the whole world will recognize and bow before Jesus Christ
The only God... is the God whom we find revealed in his Word
for the heathen Gentiles (that’s us) as well
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: They are led by an astral phenomenon
The Magi should be a great comfort to us
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who initiates the light; the Star is His instrument.

tegenstander.identificatie: Herod / Secular Scorn / Religious Novelty / Sin and Death
tekstueel_bewijs: we are all going to have to take our stand before Herod
the sophisticated scoff and the despots rage
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'despots' and 'death' itself, requiring a 'sacrifice' (Christ).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical/existential response of the believer to follow the 'star' and maintain confession in a hostile world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('We')
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Intellectual and moral courage / Faithful confession
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Christ's light drawing nations) provides the 'comfort' and basis for the secondary program (our journey).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God in Christ → Drawing all glory to Himself

voorbeelden_god_subject: The glory of God is its light
The God who created the stars... called them all by name
This baby was born to save
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must come through our own deserts
We must follow whatever star is given to us

voorbeelden: We must come through our own deserts
the Christian will ask a simple question: Does this point to Christ?
The Magi should be a great comfort to us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: While there is a 'must' (Devoir), it is grounded in the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Christ-event which 'saves the ungodly'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'vague tale' (~S1) to the 'Light of the Nations' (S1), then into the 'Shadow of the Cross' (S2), finally resolving in the 'Resurrection' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between the glory of the Magi and the 'gathering gloom' of the tomb is resolved by the 'King, God, and Sacrifice' who arises.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'stone-cold tomb' and 'Herod' are presented as real threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It frames the human action (the journey of the Magi) as a response to a cosmic light initiated by God. The 'Subject' of salvation is the 'baby born to save'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We must follow whatever star is given to us.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This baby was born to save... the ungodly.
Sorrowing, sighing, bleeding, dying, Sealed in the stone-cold tomb.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Magi are used as models of 'intellectual and moral courage', but they are explicitly identified as 'the ungodly' and 'Gentiles' who receive grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: the Magi are not heroes of effort, but representatives of the world being drawn by God's light.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and reassurance in the face of a hostile secular culture.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is an objective act of God in history that encompasses even the 'outsider'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Excellent integration of the Old Testament types, the Gospel narrative, and the Eschatological vision of Revelation.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'following our own star' and 'the star given to us' is slightly ambiguous.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: King, and God, and sacrifice... born to save... the ungodly.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned; the 'Light' and 'Word' function as the agents of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is linked to death and the 'rage' of despots.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject. The Magi are actants of 'Response' rather than 'Initiative'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Devoir (must) in the application phase.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the same Light that leads us also gives us the strength to stand before Herod.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly portrayed through the Cross and Herod.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's birth/death) correctly precedes and grounds Ethics (our stand before Herod).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses narrative structure to subordinate human 'glory' to the 'Glory of the Lamb'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'New England' imagery, Greimas reveals the underlying movement from human wisdom to divine sacrifice.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining 'who the Magi were' to how they function as actants representing the 'Receiver' of the Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Star' is a Helper that bridges the gap between the 'Natural' and 'Special' revelation axes.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like the Magi' trap by identifying the Magi with the 'ungodly' and 'Gentiles', making them recipients of grace rather than heroes of virtue.
